title: What is the relationship between Kundalini and the seven chakras in Gichtel's esoteric doctrine?
first_phrase: In this text, the Kundalini, a dormant energy represented by a serpent, can transform and awaken, leading to the renewal and transformation of the body. The author draws a comparison between Gichtel's serpent wrapped around the sun in the heart center and the Kundalini. The "centers" of the serpent have different locations in the Tantra and Gichtel, but both are seen as the base of the sevenfold structure. The settenario, or seven-fold structure, is related to the passion of the soul and the deep powers of things, and Gichtel describes it as generating "seven seals" that prevent people from perceiving divine fire.
content: Come si è visto, Gichtel dice che la Serpe genera « sette sta ture, le quali sono i sette suggelli che impediscono ai Aon-rigenerati di percepire il fuoco divino ». Questo settenario è un settenario di passione. last_phrase: In conclusion, cutting off the seven heads of the Serpent represents the liberation of the soul from the seven forms of passion, from pride to self-love, which prevent the generation of the divine fire. This preliminary operation of catharsis, represented in esotericism by the symbols of "cleansing" and "stripping," is necessary to pass from one level to another and reach the center where we can make contact with the original power and achieve full integration of the cosmic and celestial body.
